title.value: Prospects for Detecting the Diffuse Supernova Neutrino Background with JUNO
title.justification: The title concisely captures the core objective and scope of the research work.
title.quote: Prospects for Detecting the Diffuse Supernova Neutrino Background with JUNO

extractions.description: This paper explores the potential for detecting the Diffuse Supernova Neutrino Background (DSNB) at the Jiangmen Underground Neutrino Observatory (JUNO) using inverse-beta-decay (IBD) detection channels. It evaluates the DSNB flux predictions and various background sources and presents background suppression techniques like pulse shape discrimination (PSD) and triple coincidence (TC) cuts. The paper concludes with sensitivity studies, showing that JUNO can achieve significant DSNB detection or improve current DSNB flux limits.

type.justification: The paper conducts an empirical analysis using data from simulations to evaluate the DSNB detection potentials and background suppression methods at JUNO.
type.quote: We present the detection potential for the diffuse supernova neutrino background (DSNB) at the Jiangmen Underground Neutrino Observatory (JUNO)

name.justification: The research focuses on studying astrophysical phenomena, specifically the detection of the diffuse supernova neutrino background.
name.quote: The diffuse supernova neutrino background (DSNB), which is the integrated neutrino signal from all the SN explosions in the Universe, is expected to be visible in large underground neutrino detectors.

name.justification: The paper specifically investigates neutrinos as the key particle for detecting supernova events, placing it within the realm of neutrino astronomy.
name.quote: The detection of DSNB signals is important for the cosmology. It holds the precise information on the average core-collapse SN neutrino spectrum, the cosmic star-formation rate and the fraction of failed black-hole forming SNe.

name.justification: The Neural Network method from the Scikit-learn library was used for the analysis in the paper.
name.quote: The Scikit-learn toolkit [50] is used as an independent NN analysis. By using the same simulation as the BDT method, we show that the NN method can achieve consistent performance for the background suppression, demonstrating the reliability of the PSD efficiencies.

name.justification: Scikit-learn was the library used for implementing the Neural Network method.
name.quote: The Scikit-learn toolkit [50] is used as an independent NN analysis.
